title: Up 3-1 on Cavs, Pacers 'haven't done anything yet'
content: Despite a dominant Game 4 victory Sunday night that gave the Pacers a 3-1 lead over the Cavaliers in their Eastern Conference semifinal series, Indiana coach Rick Carlisle said his team is "going to keep approaching this like we have everything to prove."

title: Mathurin tossed for sparking Cavs-Pacers fracas
content: Bennedict Mathurin was ejected in the first quarter of Sunday's Game 4, while De'Andre Hunter and Myles Turner were issued technical fouls.

title: OKC finds clutch time offense to win gritty Game 4
content: The Thunder overcame their crunch-time issues and gritted out a 92-87 win over the Nuggets to even the series 2-2.

title: Reviewed goal irks Jets, helps Stars win Game 3
content: Winnipeg Jets coach Scott Arniel believes the game-winning goal, allowed by Connor Hellebuyck, should not have counted in their Game 3 loss to the Dallas Stars on Sunday night, a 5-2 defeat that put them down 2-1 in their playoff series.

title: Jokic says shooting woes 'a little bit of everything'
content: Nikola Jokic remained mired in the worst shooting funk of his career as he finished 7-of-22 Sunday in Denver's 92-87 loss to Oklahoma City in Game 4.

title: Barkov OK after Domi's hard hit in Panthers' win
content: In the closing seconds of his team's 2-0 victory in Game 4 on Sunday, Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov took a hard hit from Toronto Maple Leafs forward Max Domi, but coach Paul Maurice confirmed later that the veteran forward was "all right."

title: Day after 21-0 loss, Rockies fire manager Black
content: The Colorado Rockies, a day after losing by 21 runs to the San Diego Padres at home and off to a major-league-worst 7-33 start, fired manager Bud Black on Sunday and named third-base coach Warren Schaeffer the interim manager for the rest of the season.

title: Source: Raiders sign LB Smith, who sat out '24
content: Veteran linebacker Jaylon Smith is signing with the Raiders after a weekend tryout, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: ⚾ Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: Barcelona are about to win LaLiga, and Real Madrid let them after a wild Clásico
content: Kylian Mbappé scores a lot, but it means little when Real Madrid have ceded another trophy to Barcelona.

title: Multiple divisions in flux after welterweight, women's flyweight title fights at UFC 315
content: The domino effect from new champion Jack Della Maddalena's win over Belal Muhammad and Valentina Shevchenko's second title reign is going to be interesting.

title: Ranking top impact NFL rookies from Rounds 2-7: Who could immediately play a key role?
content: We picked out players drafted on Days 2-3 of the 2025 draft who could contribute right away, including Jets tight end Mason Taylor.

title: Can the Saints' offense find success with Tyler Shough starting as a rookie?
content: With a new coach and suddenly a new QB, the Saints' offense is hard to predict. Let's explore how this unit could look with Shough under center.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Critical Game 4s for Capitals, Knights
content: Can Washington and Vegas pull even in their series? Plus, highlights and Three Stars from Sunday's games.

title: 'Understanding what it takes to win': How Jack Eichel became a complete, 200-foot player
content: Touted as an offensive-oriented center earlier in his career, Eichel has matured into an all-situations role.

title: European soccer review: Woeful Man Utd, Spurs don't deserve UCL
content: Man Utd and Tottenham are both woeful, yet one will still be in the Champions League next year. It's almost insulting. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: 'Show a little respect,' Beckham tells Minnesota
content: Inter Miami co-owner David Beckham called on Minnesota United to "show a little respect" after a series of Instagram posts following Miami's humbling 4-1 MLS defeat on Saturday.

title: Yamal: Barça don't fear Madrid like other teams
content: Lamine Yamal has told ESPN that Barcelona don't fear Real Madrid like other teams do after the Catalan club won a fourth consecutive Clásico.

title: Amorim could leave Man Utd if bad form continues
content: Ruben Amorim has accepted his job will be under threat if he cannot fix Manchester United's Premier League form.

title: Díaz keen to extend Liverpool stay amid exit talk
content: Liverpool forward Luis Díaz has expressed his desire to stay at Anfield amid continued speculation over his future.

title: Arteta slams 'unacceptable' Arsenal performance
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has described his team's performance against Liverpool as "unacceptable", despite the fact they game from 2-0 down to clinch an important point at Anfield.

title: Forest's Nuno defends owner after on-pitch clash
content: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis stormed onto the pitch to remonstrate with coach Nuno Espirito Santo after Sunday's Premier League draw against Leicester City.

title: Mourinho sarcastically explains team selection
content: Frustrated Fenerbahce coach Jose Mourinho answered sarcastically that he "throws coins in the air" after being asked how he selects his starting XI.

title: Mbappé breaks Madrid record with Clásico hat trick
content: Kylian Mbappé broke the record for the most goals scored in a debut season at Real Madrid after scoring a hat trick in the team's high-stakes Clásico clash with Barcelona on Sunday.

title: ⚽ Offside goal ruins club's invincible season
content: Invincible seasons are the stuff of football folklore. For Melbourne City to be denied one by such a blatant offside will go down in infamy.

title: Impact freshmen and talented transfers: These teams have the best groups of newcomers for 2025
content: Building a roster isn't just about recruiting. Combining prep talent with great transfers is key in college football and these teams did it best.

title: Cooper Flagg, 5-on-5 workouts and prospects to watch at the NBA draft combine
content: With 120 players expected at the NBA draft combine in Chicago, here's everything to watch out for and know.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Jadon Sancho's next move could be to Bayer Leverkusen
content: Bayer Leverkusen are willing to offer Man United's Jadon Sancho a career lifeline this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "No Enemy Aircraft Was Allowed To...": Indian Navy On Operation Sindoor
content: No enemy aircraft was allowed to come within hundreds of kilometres of Indian territory during Pakistan's attempts to target the country's installations last week, Director General of Naval Operations, Vice Admiral A N Pramod, said on Monday.

title: 17 New Born Girls Named 'Sindoor' In UP After Indian Army's Military Op
content: Inspired by Operation Sindoor, India's military action against Pakistan to avenge the Pahalgam terror attack last month, 17 newborn girls here have been named Sindoor by their families.

title: "Pak Army Responsible For Their Losses, Our Fight Was Against Terrorists": India
content: Indian armed forces reiterated today that the Operation Sindoor targeted only terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, and the Pakistan military was responsible for any loss that they incurred.

title: "All Systems Fully Functional, Ready For Ops If Needed In Future": India
content: India said all its military bases are fully functional and continue to remain so, debunking Pakistan's claims that it struck Indian bases.

title: Qatar's 'Flying Palace' Worth $400 Million To Serve As Trump's Air Force One
content: Boeing 747-8 is called the "flying palace" for its luxurious interior, punctuated by well-designed bathrooms, private bedrooms, and even a grand staircase.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump The Showman Is Not Enough For West Asia Anymore
content: President Donald Trump swayed stiffly but gamely side to side, a ceremonial sword in hand, surrounded by robed Saudi men dancing, chanting and clashing blades.

title: Videos Show Massive Damage To Pak Military Bases After Operation Sindoor
content: India on Monday released videos showing the damage to Pakistani military air bases during Operation Sindoor, which was launched on May 7 to avenge the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam last month.

title: 'Tool For Grifters': AI Deepfakes Push Consumers Into Buying Dubious Products
content: Rapid advances in artificial intelligence have fueled what researchers call an AI dystopia, a deception-filled online universe designed to manipulate unsuspecting users into buying dubious products.

title: Modern Warfare: Facing Russian Drone Problem, Ukraine's Underground Solution
content: As thousands of explosive-laden drones scour both sides of the front in Russia's 39-month-long war on Ukraine, armoured vehicle and their crews are being moved underground. To keep them safe and the artillery operational.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Live Updates: Special Armed Forces Briefing On Operation Sindoor Underway
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE updates: India and Pakistan reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea, with immediate effect on Saturday.

title: Pak Says Man Who Led Terrorists' Funeral "A Family Man". US Disagrees
content: The Pakistani armed forces have claimed that Hafiz Abdur Rauf, a US-designated global terrorist, who led the funeral of the terrorists killed in Indian airstrikes during Operation Sindoor is an ordinary citizen.

title: "War Is Not Romantic, Not Your Bollywood Movie": Ex-Army Chief Manoj Naravane
content: Speaking at an event in Pune, former Indian Army chief General Manoj Naravane said if ordered, he would go to war, but diplomacy would be his first choice.

title: Video: US Politician Shows Secret Passageway Under Lincoln Room In Capitol
content: Tim Moore said the secret room used to be the House's post office when Abraham Lincoln was the president.

title: US Navy Officer Charged With Murder After Wife Found Dead In Hotel Room
content: A US Navy officer charged with murder is facing death penalty, six months after his wife's body was found in a Japanese hotel room.

title: Hamas To Release US-Israeli Hostage Edan Alexander Today
content: Edan Alexander, 21,was serving in the Israeli army when he was captured by Hamas during its attack on Israel in October, 2023.

title: "Industrial Accident": China Court On Man Who Died During Workplace Sex
content: The security guard's son claimed in court that his father's working conditions prevented him from pursuing a romantic relationship outside of work.

title: "Reflects Close Bonds": Maldives As India Extends Financial Support
content: India has extended crucial financial support to the Maldives through the rollover of the USD 50 million Treasury Bill for one more year.

title: US, China Reach Deal To Slash Reciprocal Tariffs By 115%
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other's products, according to a joint statement released in Geneva, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world's two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences.

title: How Ultra-Rich Are Protecting Themselves Against Kidnapping, Attacks
content: Tensions among the ultra-wealthy escalated after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was shot dead in December 2024.

title: Watch: Indian missile strikes level two key Pakistan airbases
content: India's armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, delivering a significant blow to Pakistan's military infrastructure by destroying Nur Khan Airbase, a vital hub for Pakistan's air power. The operation, a response to a terror attack in Pahalgam, involved precision strikes on key installations and terror launchpads.

title: Bill Gates' ex-wife opens up on his plan to give away wealth: 'Think it's...'
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: 'If Thomson don't get ya ... ': DGMO's cricket analogy for India's defence system
content: India showcased its robust air defence capabilities, effectively countering Pakistani aerial attacks with a sophisticated, multi-layered system. The Indian military displayed evidence of successful strikes on Pakistani airbases, emphasizing the precision and impact of the Indian Air Force's operations. Indigenous systems like the Akash missile played a crucial role, highlighting India's growing self-reliance in defence technology.

title: 'Tears you never showed': Anushka's emotional farewell to Virat Kohli
content: Following Virat Kohli's Test retirement announcement, his wife Anushka Sharma shared an emotional tribute, highlighting his unwavering dedication to the game. Kohli, who debuted in 2011, concluded his 14-year Test career with 9,230 runs and 30 centuries. Kohli’s decision to retire came just days after Rohit Sharma also stepped away from Test cricket, leaving India without two of its most senior batters ahead of the upcoming tour of England. The five-Test series begins on June 20, and India will now need to appoint a new captain and rework its batting core.

title: 'A thread from your late father': Tendulkar reveals Kohli's unseen tribute
content: Sachin Tendulkar penned an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli upon his Test retirement, recalling a touching gesture from Kohli during Tendulkar's final Test. Tendulkar lauded Kohli's incredible Test career, highlighting his contribution of inspiring a new generation of passionate cricket fans and players. Kohli’s retirement comes just days after Rohit Sharma stepped down from Test cricket, removing two senior batters from selection contention ahead of India’s upcoming tour of England.

title: Pakistanis often claim to be Indian out of embarrassment, says LinkedIn post
content: Sarthak Ahuja, an Indian investment banker, claimed on LinkedIn that Pakistanis abroad often conceal their nationality, posing as Indians due to embarrassment over Pakistan's global image. He cited an incident in New York and observed this pattern in various countries, including the UK, where Pakistani-run restaurants are labeled as "Indian." Ahuja believes India's positive brand helps them.

title: Sensex spikes 3,000 points: Top 5 reasons bulls are partying today
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on India-Pakistan ceasefire and US-China trade deal progress. Both indices rallied over 3.5% cheered by domestic stability and favourable global news to register their biggest single gain in 4 years.

title: 10-year-old girl raped & killed in graveyard in UP's Saharanpur
content: In Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, a devastating incident occurred where a 10-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by a 50-year-old neighbor. The accused abducted the girl while she was playing near her home, committing the heinous crime in a graveyard. Subsequently, he strangled her and concealed the body in nearby bushes, leading to his arrest and ongoing investigation.

title: Mumbai's Gokhale Bridge fully opens after seven years of distress
content: After seven years of disruption due to a tragic collapse and subsequent reconstruction, the Gokhale Bridge in Mumbai is fully operational, restoring vital connectivity between Andheri East and West. The reopening alleviates pressure on the waterlogged Andheri subway, offering relief to residents, especially with the approaching monsoon.

title: Indian software developer reveals Swedish work perks, internet reacts
content: An Indian software developer's Instagram post showcasing the generous corporate perks in Sweden has gone viral, sparking admiration and envy among Indian professionals. The video highlights benefits like extensive paid leave, wellness allowances, work-from-home setup assistance, and parental benefits commonly offered by Swedish companies.

title: Jaipur's Sawai Mansingh Stadium receives bomb threat email
content: A bomb threat triggered an evacuation of Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur today. Additional SP Lalit Sharma reported that the threatening email was sent to the Sports Council's official email ID. Authorities promptly vacated the stadium, and the Bomb Disposal Squad, supported by the Dog Squad, is currently conducting a thorough investigation to ensure the safety of the premises.

title: Behind beer bust: Why your favourite pint is missing from Delhi’s shelves
content: Delhi's beer market faces a slump as popular brands vanish from government-run stores, pushing consumers to neighboring states or spirits. This decline, evidenced by a 37% drop in beer sales, is attributed to brand pushing, higher profit margins on specific imports, and policy issues. The government is analyzing sales patterns and profit margins to address the availability challenges.

title: Virat Kohli retires, legendary India batter bows out before England series
content: Virat Kohli, a celebrated Indian cricketer, has retired from Test cricket, marking the end of an era. The 36-year-old amassed 9,230 runs in 123 Tests, averaging 48.7. His final series in Australia proved challenging, and his retirement arrives amidst questions about his form. Kohli led India to their first Test series win in Australia and topped the ICC Test rankings.

title: 3 held for posting fake videos about terror attack in UP
content: Police in Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh, have filed cases against three individuals for allegedly spreading false information about a terrorist attack in the district. According to Superintendent of Police Rajesh Dwivedi, the fake videos, circulated on Instagram and Facebook, included sounds of firing and text claiming a terror attack, causing public fear.

title: Indore stadium receives 2nd bomb threat mail in 3 days; people evacuated
content: Authorities evacuated Indore's Holkar Stadium following a second bomb threat in three days. Police initiated a search after the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association (MPCA) received an email threatening an explosion. While no suspicious objects were found, this incident follows a similar hoax email received on May 9.

title: 'Deeply irresponsible': NCW condemns abuse against Vikram Misri and his daughter
content: The National Commission for Women has denounced the online abuse targeting Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri's family, particularly his daughter, after his announcement of the India-Pakistan ceasefire. Sharing her personal contact information online was condemned as a grave breach of privacy and a threat to her safety.

title: Ravi Shastri's emotional farewell to Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli, the celebrated Indian batter, has retired from Test cricket after a stellar 14-year career. He played 123 matches, amassing 9,230 runs with 30 centuries and 31 half-centuries. Kohli also holds the record for most Test wins as India's captain. His departure, following Rohit Sharma's exit, leaves a void in the Indian batting lineup ahead of the England tour.

title: Kerala man wins Rs 8.5 crore jackpot in Dubai Duty Free draw after 15 years of trying
content: Venugopal Mullacheri, an Indian expat from Kasaragod, Kerala, has won USD 1 million in the Dubai Duty Free Millennium Millionaire draw after 15 years of participation. The 52-year-old IT specialist, residing in Ajman, purchased the winning ticket at Dubai International Airport while returning from his hometown. Overjoyed by the win, Mullacheri expressed his relief and gratitude to Dubai Duty Free

title: Government busts Pakistan's fake video claim of damage to Indian airfield
content: India has refuted Pakistan's false claims of damage to an Indian airfield, exposing a doctored video presented by Pakistan's DG ISPR. The PIB fact-check unit released the full video, proving it actually showed damage to a Pakistani base. India condemned the disinformation, reaffirming that Bathinda airfield remains undamaged and operational, countering the misleading narrative.

title: US, China suspend part of their tariffs for 90 days; tariffs to come down 115%
content: The United States and China have agreed to a 90-day part suspension of tariffs, signaling a potential breakthrough in trade negotiations. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced the suspension alongside a commitment to significantly reduce existing tariff rates by 115%.

title: Tata Electronics looks to double Apple iPhones enclosures production in India
content: Tata Electronics is significantly boosting its iPhone enclosure production at its Hosur facility, aligning with Apple's plan to make India a primary iPhone manufacturing hub for the US. The expansion aims to double the existing capacity.

title: Virat Kohli's brother pens an emotional note on his Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas, expressed immense pride following Virat's Test retirement announcement. Vikas shared heartfelt messages on Instagram, acknowledging Virat's incredible journey and irreplaceable contributions to the game. Virat retired after a remarkable 123-match Test career, amassing 9,230 runs, 30 centuries, and holding the record as India's most successful Test captain with 40 wins.

title: Mother's Day: Revisiting JD Vance’s complex relationship with his mother
content: JD Vance's challenging childhood in Middletown, Ohio, marked by instability and his mother's addiction, shaped his path. Raised amidst chaos, he found refuge with his maternal grandparents, who provided stability and guidance. Vance credits them for his success, from Yale Law to becoming Vice President, highlighting the resilience needed to overcome adversity and honoring the woman who raised him.

title: Gambhir drops surprise nickname for Virat Kohli after retirement
content: Gautam Gambhir and others wished Virat Kohli after his Test retirement announcement. Gambhir acknowledged Kohli's passion, saying he'd miss him. Kohli, who played 123 Tests, scoring 9230 runs, stated he was grateful for his journey. He led India to number one and a historic Australia series win. Kohli will now focus on ODIs, having retired from T20Is.

title: Pope Leo XIV calls for peace in first Sunday address
content: Pope Leo XIV, in his inaugural Sunday address, passionately appealed for global peace, echoing the sentiments of his predecessor. He specifically called for a ceasefire and hostage release in Gaza, a peaceful resolution in Ukraine, and expressed hope for lasting accord between India and Pakistan. The new pontiff's words resonated deeply with the massive crowd gathered in St. Peter's Square.

title: 'Koi nahin hai takker mein': Former India cricketer lauds Virat Kohli
content: Navjot Sidhu praised Virat Kohli as the greatest Indian cricketer after Kohli's Test retirement announcement. Kohli reflected on his 14-year Test career, expressing gratitude for the challenges and lessons learned. He amassed 9,230 runs, including 30 centuries, and captained India in 68 Test matches, securing 40 wins, though his recent batting average had declined.

title: Body found in suitcase: Mom, lover detained for 10-year-old son’s murder
content: In Guwahati's Basistha area, a woman and her lover have been arrested for allegedly murdering her 10-year-old son. The child's body was discovered stuffed in a trolley bag and discarded in a bush near the Basistha temple. Police identified the accused as Depali Rajbongshi and Jyotirmoy Haloi.

title: 32 airports closed for flights now open after India-Pak ceasefire; check full list
content: Following the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India has lifted the NOTAMs, reopening several airports across north and north-western India for civilian flights after a temporary suspension. The Airports Authority of India revoked the suspension, which had led to numerous flight cancellations.

title: 'Why?' Who said what on Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli, who captained India to the WTC final in 2021, has announced his retirement from Test cricket after 123 matches. He scored 9230 runs, including 30 centuries and 31 half-centuries. Kohli expressed gratitude for the game and his experiences, while former cricketer Harbhajan Singh questioned the timing of his decision.

title: US welcomes India-Pakistan ceasefire, applauds diplomatic breakthrough
content: The US welcomed the India-Pakistan ceasefire, praising both nations for choosing diplomacy. President Trump and secretary Rubio urged continued communication. The ceasefire followed India’s Operation Sindoor, which neutralized over 100 terrorists and targeted Pakistani airbases. India’s military commanders highlighted the operation's success, while Vice Admiral Pramod issued a stern warning to Pakistan against further aggression.

title: A list of Virat Kohli's most controversial moments in Test cricket
content: Virat Kohli's Test career was marked by both exceptional performance and fiery controversies. From his infamous middle-finger incident in Sydney to the DRS 'cheating' saga against Steve Smith, Kohli never shied away from confrontation. His intense rivalry with James Anderson and the stump mic outburst in Cape Town further fuelled his controversial image.

title: 'I love you': IAF martyr Moga's wife clutches his uniform as family bids final goodbye
content: Sergeant Surendra Kumar Moga, a medical assistant, was killed in a Pakistani strike in Udhampur, prompting a massive outpouring of grief in his village. Thousands lined the streets to pay their respects as his body was transported for cremation. His daughter vowed to join the army to avenge his death, highlighting the family's ultimate sacrifice. Prominent politicians attended the funeral.

title: Germany turns first asylum seekers away at border — report
content: Germany has started turning away asylum seekers at its borders with other European nations. This action follows the government's recent tightening of immigration policies. In a two-day period, authorities rejected many migrants due to invalid visas and fake documents. They also detained smugglers and individuals linked to extremism. The move has sparked criticism from politicians and neighboring EU countries.

title: Madhya Pradesh youth slits friend's throat, sends video to deceased's kin
content: In Rewa district, Rajnish Mishra murdered his friend Abhishek Tripathi over a money dispute. Mishra, with accomplices, filmed the gruesome act in Bhokri forests. The video was sent to Tripathi's family, who alerted the police. Rajkumar, who filmed the murder, was arrested first. Later, Rajnish and Adarsh Mishra were also apprehended. All three are now in jail

title: Which top Pak officials attended funerals of terrorists killed in Op Sindoor?
content: India has released names of Pakistani officials who attended the funeral of LeT terrorist Abdul Rauf, killed during 'Operation Sindoor,' which targeted terror facilities in PoK and Pakistan. Senior military officials and the Punjab Inspector General were present. Indian forces eliminated key terrorists, including Khalid Abu Akasha, linked to arms trafficking.

title: Are banks closed on May 12 for Buddha Purnima? Check state-wise list
content: Banks across multiple Indian cities, including Delhi and Mumbai, are closed today, May 12, for Buddha Purnima. While over-the-counter services are unavailable, online banking, mobile apps, and ATMs remain operational. Normal banking activities will resume on Tuesday, May 13. Looking ahead, banks will also be closed on various dates later in May for state-specific holidays and weekends.

title: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma spotted at Mumbai airport after retirement announcement
content: Virat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket after a remarkable 14-year career, amassing 9230 runs, including 30 centuries. He and his wife, Anushka Sharma, were spotted at the Mumbai airport shortly after the announcement. Kohli, India's most successful Test captain with 40 wins, expressed gratitude for the game and his experiences, stepping away with a heart full of gratitude.

title: How Virat Kohli fared in Australia - A tale of peaks and one final dip
content: Virat Kohli concluded his Test career with a remarkable legacy, particularly in Australia. Despite a disappointing final series, his record Down Under stands out, amassing 1542 runs in 18 matches with seven centuries. Kohli's fierce batting against Australia included 2232 runs in 30 Tests, solidifying his status as one of India's greatest overseas Test performers.

title: Carney in trouble: Nearly 1.6 mn out of job in Canada, 30,000+ cuts in April
content: Canada's economy faces headwinds as April 2025 saw a meager 7,400 jobs added, pushing unemployment to 6.9%. U.S. tariffs on key exports like steel and automobiles are significantly impacting the manufacturing sector, leading to job losses. While the public sector offered slight relief, broader economic concerns persist, pressuring the Bank of Canada to consider interest rate cuts.

title: Everything to know about Monday's draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: the 2025 NBA draft lottery brings its annual wave of intrigue Monday . the entire league descending on Chicago and offseason proceedings fully underway for most every franchise . at least 13 teams in the lottery hang heavily on which combinations are drawn . a host of intriguing young players -- many freshmen -- behind them .

title: Jackson's red card leaves Chelsea without a striker, despite £1B spending
content: chelsea have two games to make their £1 billion transfer gamble pay off . they will have to do it without a striker in their two most crucial games of the season . a recent premier league revival saw Chelsea climb back into the top five ahead of the clash with Newcastle at St James' Park .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Pacers rout Cavs in massive Game 4 victory
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . a similar pattern is playing out on the other side of the East bracket .

title: Derek Carr retires: Who will start now? What's his legacy?
content: Jeremy Fowler joins "SportsCenter" to discuss Derek Carr's retirement . medical scans determined that Carr had sustained a labral tear and had significant degenerative changes to his rotator cuff . it's the closure New Orleans has been looking for since April 11 .

title: 'Struck with BrahMos by IAF': Pounding of Pak airbases was turning point
content: Inside Virat-Anushka’s dreamy vacations 10 national parks In India to visit this summer 8 things you should never apply to your face 7 Foods that can naturally boost hair growth Saniya Iyappan radiates elegance in sarees Jasmin Bhasin’s top 10 ultra-glam looks ​Beyond hummus: 8 creative ways to use chickpeas in daily diet​ Best photos of South actresses from this week 8 places in India with unbelievable landscapes

title: 'Pak chose to back terrorists': DGMO briefing on Operation Sindoor
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the toi news desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape .

title: "Destroy Enemy In The Sky": India Confirms Downing Pakistani Mirage Jet
content: the video, titled 'Destroy the Enemy in the Sky', featured footage of several army, navy and air force operations . one part of the video displayed a still collage of what appeared to be wreckage of military equipment . this led to reports that the Indian armed forces destroyed a Pakistani Mirage fighter jet during the ongoing tensions .

title: Turkish drones, Chinese missiles: What Pak used in failed attacks on India
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 hits Pakistan today, follows Saturday's twin tremors
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: PM Modi to address nation at around 8 p.m. on May 12
content: The address comes two days after India and Pakistan reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect

title: Operation Sindoor: Credit for military response should go to Indian armed forces and not to any political party, Karnataka CM Siddarmaiah
content: Chief Minister welcomes ceasefire, but said the Centre should have convened an all-party meeting and a special session of Parliament before taking a decision on the ceasefire

title: BRS leader Kavitha accuses Telangana govt. of conspiring to mortgage 1.75 lakh acres TGIIC lands to raise loans
content: BRS leader Kavitha alleges that the Telangana Congress government has issued orders to change the status of TGIIC to public ltd from private one to list it on stock exchange

title: All military bases, systems remain fully operational: DG Air Operations
content: Director General of Air Operations, IAF, Air Marshal A.K. Bharti said India’s robust air defence system effectively thwarted Pakistani attempts to target Indian installations

title: Maharashtra SSC 2025 result: Check Class 10 results online from May 13 – official websites and re-evaluation details
content: SSC exam results for February-March 2025 will be available online on May 13, with options for verification and photocopy requests.

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah visits those injured in Pakistan shelling in Poonch
content: The Poonch district in J&L accounted for the highest 20 of the total 27 fatalities with over 50 others injured since Wednesday (May 7) shortly after India carried out Operation Sindoor.

title: Tiruvannamalai AIADMK functionary denies donating blood at camp after video of her ‘pretending’ goes viral
content: In a video shot by the party cadre, Ms. Jayasudha was seen lying on a medical bed with the blood donation line strapped to her arm. A few minutes later, she was also checked by a physician, who was present at the camp

title: Weapons, explosives seized after encounter with Maoists on Maharashtra-Chhattisgarh border
content: The exchange between the security forces and Maoists took place at three locations and lasted two hours, Gadchiroli police said.

title: Hyundai initiative helps Chenchus take up sustainable  agroforestry
content: Diversified agroforestry practices taken up under the initiative, including intercropping, have enhanced household incomes, generating ₹24.56 lakh across four villages during the last two years

title: ISRO to launch earth imaging satellite from Sriharikota on May 18, MPs to witness event
content: The EOS-09 satellite, weighing around 1,710 kg, will join India's growing constellation of Earth observation assets, addressing the need for expanded real-time coverage across the country’s vast territory

title: All-faith conference in Goa condemns actions of Pakistan
content: The solemn assembly was convened to express unwavering support for the Indian armed forces and the Union Government for their steadfast efforts in defending the nation’s sovereignty and integrity

title: Indore stadium receives another bomb threat email; people evacuated
content: Holkar Stadium in Indore evacuated twice in three days due to bomb threats; one suspect arrested in another instance of bomb threat in Indore; police investigate

title: 441 students from Andhra Pradesh reach New Delhi after the outbreak of India-Pakistan conflict
content: According to an official release, the Chandrababu Naidu-led government has worked round-the-clock to bring its students back safely from the States that faced the threat of attacks post-Operation Sindoor and provided them food and shelter.

title: Man arrested over call to Kochi naval base seeking INS Vikrant’s location
content: According to police sources, the accused claimed to be undergoing psychiatric treatment, though this remains to be verified

title: NTR district Collector launches awareness on fire safety
content: Mr. Lakshmisha has asked the women, students and the employees to acquaint knowledge on operating fire fighting equipment

title: More basic facilities planned at Srisailam temple
content: The management of Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Swamy temple in Saisailam is gearing up to provide basic facilities on par with the increasing number of devotees to the shrine.

title: At least 30 devotees from Tamil Nadu injured in bus accident in Tirupati
content: An APSRTC bus of Tirumala Depot met with road accident near Agarala, Chandragiri mandal in Tirupati on Sunday night

title: Maharashtra SSC 10th results to be out on May 13
content: The results for Maharashtra SSC 10th standards will be announced around 1 pm on May 13 on the official websites.

title: General purpose grant: Kerala govt releases second instalment of ₹213.43 crore to local bodies
content: Grama panchayats will receive ₹150.23 crore and block panchayats, ₹11.23 crore. Districts panchayats are eligible for ₹7.89 crore, municipalities ₹ 25.83 crore and corporations, ₹18.25 crore

title: NCW condemns online trolling of Vikram Misri's daughter
content: The women’s panel denounced the sharing of the personal contact details of Vikram Misri’s daughter, calling it a “grossly irresponsible act” and a “serious breach of privacy” that endangers her safety.

title: Sunny Joseph assumes charge as Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee president
content: Adoor Prakash takes charge as UDF convener and Shafi Parambil, P.C. Vishnunadh and A.P. Anil Kumar, as KPCC working presidents

title: Fire at Valasaravakkam home that claimed lives of elderly couple caused by electrical overload: police
content: At around 1.30 p.m., a fire broke out in one of the rooms on the ground floor, and the pooja room — where a lamp had been lit — allowed the fire, caused by an electrical overload, to escalate quickly

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire: Life returning to normal in border districts of Punjab
content: Border areas of Punjab return to normalcy after India-Pakistan ceasefire; schools remain closed as precaution while markets back to normal activity

title: India extends financial support to Maldives through rollover of $50 million Treasury Bill
content: At the request of the Maldivian government, the State Bank of India (SBI) has subscribed, for one more year, a $50 million Government Treasury Bill issued by the Ministry of Finance of Maldives, the Indian High Commission in the Maldives said

title: Mamata spoke to me, assured of effort for my husband's release: Wife of BSF jawan detained by Pakistan
content: The wife of the BSF personnel said she is hopeful that her husband could be brought back through a possible swap with a Pakistani Ranger who was apprehended by Indian forces in Rajasthan

title: When the North of India plunged into darkness
content: The Indian Government instructed blackouts for the first time since the Indo-Pak War of 1971 and even though a ceasefire, announced on May 10, brought some respite that lasted a few hours, the situation remains grim and unpredictable. What is it like to live near the border right now?

title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting ahead of India, Pakistan DGMOs talk
content: NSA Ajit Doval, Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan and all three service chiefs were among those who attended the meeting.

title: High drama at Bengaluru pub as security guard claims he locked up an armed intruder; QRTs find cash stolen but no sign of suspect
content: Investigation revealed that the intruder entered the premises of Geometry Brewery and Kitchen in Malleswaram by breaking open the back door, made his way to the brewery office on the third floor, damaged a few CCTV cameras and made away with cash of around ₹50,000 from the cashbox.

title: 15 godowns gutted in fire at village in Thane district; no casualty
content: Fire in Thane district godowns containing petroleum products, no casualties reported, fire under control after 6 hours

title: 32 airports closed due to India-Pakistan tensions set to reopen
content: Civil flight operations from 32 airports across northern and western India, including Srinagar and Amritsar, were suspended from May 9 to May 15

title: Maharashtra police search home of Kerala activist held for ‘plotting war’ against Union govt
content: Maharashtra police team is assisted by personnel from Anti-Terrorist Squad of Kerala Police during search carried out at residence of Rejaz M Sheeba Sydeek (26) within Edappally police station limits

title: Watch: What goes on behind the scenes at Chennai Metro Rail?
content: Its workforce is highly efficient, taking commuters to their destinations, safe and fast. The Hindu takes the reader through every step of the operation

title: Mortal remains of BSF Sub-Inspector Mohammed Imteyaz reach Patna, leaders pay tribute
content: Apart from Bihar CM Nitish, Minister Nitin Nabin, BJP President Dilip Jaiswal, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and other leaders paid tribute to the slain BSF jawan

title: Delhi airport says operations are currently smooth
content: The Delhi International Airport Ltd said while the airport operations are currently smooth, “due to changing airspace conditions and increased security measures, some flight schedules and security checkpoint processing times may be affected”

title: At least 10 satellites working to ensure safety and security of India: ISRO Chief V Narayanan
content: ISRO chief highlighted the organisation’s effort to ensure the country’s safety amid the tensions with Pakistan

title: India-Pakistan DGMO level talks deferred till May 12 evening
content: The two countries agreed on the understanding after three days of intense military hostilities since May 7, when Operation Sindoor commenced

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire understanding: No incidents reported, last night remained ‘largely peaceful’ in J&K, says Army
content: “The night remained largely peaceful across Jammu and Kashmir and other areas along the International border,” the Army said

title: Spoiler alert: New political parties spring up in poll-bound Bihar
content: Aap Sabki Awaz (Rashtriya) by former IAS officer R.C.P. Singh, Inquilab Party (IIP) by former Congress leader I.P. Gupta and Hind Sena Party by former IPS officer Shivdeep Wamanrao Lande may queer the pitch for the big players

title: Vikram Misri online trolling row: Former diplomat, politicians come out in support
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi and former Foreign Secretary Nirupama Menon expressed their support for Mr. Misri

title: How is Kerala handling its waste problem? | Explained
content: What is the ‘Vruthi’ campaign? How has waste increased in Kerala society? Is this campaign different from the Swachh Bharat Mission? Are decentralised waste management systems better than centralised ones?

title: 13 dead, 11 injured in trailer-truck collision in Raipur
content: Four children and nine women died in the road accident that happened late Sunday (May 11, 2025) night near Saragaon on Raipur-Balodabazar road in Raipur district

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire LIVE: DGMOs set to hold talks; PM Modi to address nation tonight
content: All Indian military bases and systems remain fully operational, ready to undertake any mission, says Air Marshal

title: CPI accuses BJP of using religion as political weapon to gain power
content: Mr. Nageswara Rao was in the city to participate as chief guest in the Visakhapatnam district’s 25th ‘Maha Sabhalu’ on Sunday

title: Special officers appointed for Saraswati Pushkaralu; Minister Sridhar Babu inspects preparations
content: The 12-day Saraswati Pushkaralu will begin on May 15 at Triveni Sangamam near Kaleshwaram, where the Godavari, Pranahita, and the invisible Saraswati rivers converge

title: No compromise if somebody hurts dignity of court, says Justice Gavai
content: The Chief Justice of India-designate says “some other judges would have taken a different view” of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey’s comments against the Supreme Court and Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna

title: The women who remain largely invisible
content: Too often, women do the groundwork — organising, protesting, feeding, and sustaining movements — without having a seat at the table

title: The curious case of Kejriwal’s ‘shift’ from Delhi to Punjab
content: While Mr. Kejriwal has gone quiet in Delhi, he has been making frequent and visible appearances in Punjab

title: Gandhi Hill all set to receive a major facelift
content: With the government clearing the decks for its renovation, good days are ahead for the historic site, where a memorial for Mahatma Gandhi stands and which has fallen into disrepair in the recent years

title: Wife of BSF constable detained by Pakistan seeks meeting with Bengal CM Mamata
content: The BSF jawan inadvertently crossed the international border on April 23 and was taken into custody by Pakistan Rangers. Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee has also taken up the issue and spoken to the Director General of the BSF

title: Experts shed light on rising importance of data during The Hindu Education Plus Career Counselling Series webinar
content: Experts emphasize the value of integrating economics with data science in academic programmes and that working with data is no longer optional but an essential skill

title: Prison inmates’ spirit shines at Cherlapally as annual sports and cultural meet ends on a high note
content: The meet, running from May 9 to 11, blended athleticism with artistry and aimed to provide inmates with a structured platform for reinvention and reintegration

title: Telangana finds its chill; beer sales jump by 65% amid heatwave
content: Daily sales began climbing in early May, peaking at 2.9 lakh cases on May 4, as per data from Telangana Excise and Prohibition Department

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri abused on social media; IAS, IPS associations come out in support
content: Vikram Misri had to lock his X account following abusive comments on his daughter by users who blamed him for the cessation of military operations agreed with Pakistan. The IAS Association condemns the “unwarranted personal attacks on civil servants performing their duties with integrity”

title: World’s longest banana infructescence found in the forests of Andamans
content: An infructescence of about 4.2 metres long has been recorded in an endemic species of wild banana, the Musa indandamanensis. Specimens of  the infructescence are on display at the Indian Museum in Kolkata

title: Pakistan will have to pay a very heavy price if it resorts to any misadventure, says DGMO
content: 35-40 Pakistani military personnel killed in combat, key installations damaged during Operation Sindoor; the officer warns Pak. against ‘misadventure’, pays tribute to 5 Indian military casualties

title: Fishers oppose hydrocarbon project at Wadge Bank in Kanniyakumari
content: The Union Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas had issued a notice inviting bids under the Hydrocarbon Exploration and Licensing Policy for exploration of oil and natural gas from three areas in South of Cape Comorin.

title: UGC tells institutions to increase number of seats, admit more foreign students
content: Stressing need for internationalisation of higher education, UGC Secretary Manish R. Joshi urges institutions to implement the Commission’s 2022 guidelines to create up to 25% ‘supernumerary seats’, over and above the sanctioned enrolment, for international students in UG and PG courses

title: Vanniyar Youth Conference at Mamallapuram: Ramadoss warns of extensive protests seeking reservation for the community
content: Addressing a massive Vanniyar youth conference – held by the Vanniyar Sangam after 12 years - at Mamallapuram, PMK president Anbumani Ramadoss alleged that Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has betrayed the Vanniyar community by refusing to provide internal reservations for them within the MBC quota

title: Indus Waters Treaty to be kept in abeyance as Pakistan resorted to cross-border terror: source
content: The Indus Waters Treaty has to be modified to ‘make it suitable for the 21st century requirements of the Indian state’, the senior official said, adding there would be rapid infrastructure development works in the rivers that were a part of the treaty

title: Demand to strengthen govt. hospitals in Kozhikode
content: On the night of May 2, a temporary facility was set up at the general hospital to shift patients from the casualty ward of the Government MCH after a minor explosion in the UPS room

title: Foreign investors inject ₹14,167 crore in equities this month
content: Foreign investors show confidence in Indian equity market despite India-Pakistan tensions, driven by global cues and domestic fundamentals

title: Drones spotted over Rajasthan’s Barmer, blackout continues in border districts
content: In Barmer, police personnel took to the streets and asked those returning home after closing their shops to switch off the lights of their vehicles

title: Trade unions welcome ceasefire, call for peace in the interest of workers
content: Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) general secretary Tapan Sen said in a statement that upon receiving the news of the stoppage of war, the people from both countries heaved a sigh of great relief as they needed peace for their own progress

title: Senior Puri Jagannath temple priest suspended for involvement in consecration of Digha temple
content: Sevayat Ramkrishna Das Mohapatra had remarked that the daru (sacred wood) used in the Digha temple in West Bengal had been procured from the surplus wood of the Nabakalebara rituals at the Puri shrine

title: Teachers’ body to stage state-wide protests today
content: The leaders warned that if the government failed to heed the demands, they would intensify the agitation and would stage a massive sit-in at the Vidya Bhavan on May 15

title: Digambara poet urges Naidu to build memorial stupa for Amaravati farmers
content: The names of all farmers who willingly donated their lands for the construction of Amaravati should be etched on a commemorative plaque at the site, says Nagna Muni

title: Displaced people hope to return home as guns fall silent along the LoC in J&K
content: Many villagers in both Jammu and Kashmir regions have returned to their damaged houses and resumed their daily routine; however, many such villages may still remain out of bounds for residents because of littered live explosives

title: New statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj inaugurated at Sindhudurg
content: Less than a year after the previous grand statue collapsed, a bigger ‘structure engineered for durability’ has been inaugurated at the same location by Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: Operation Sindoor objectives achieved; losses are part of combat but pilots are back home, says IAF
content: Indian Air Force’s Director General of Air Operations (DGAO) Air Marshal Bharti on Sunday said, “...at this time I would not like to comment on that because we are still in a combat situation. If I comment on anything, it will be only advantage adversary. So, we don’t want to give him any advantage at this stage.”

title: Gold that went missing from Padmanabhaswamy temple found
content: According to the Fort police, the gold rod which was kept for carrying out gold plating work on the door of the sanctum sanctorum was found on the ground between the strong room and the place where the work was ongoing

title: Clarify if Government accepted third party mediation on Kashmir, says Congress
content: Congress demands clarification on third party mediation in Kashmir, criticises internationalisation attempts, and also recalls 1971 Indo-Pakistan War

title: Police conduct ‘flash’ checks across Kurnool
content: The operations were conducted at railway stations, bus stands, and border check-posts, with the assistance of bomb squads, dog squads and crime branch teams.
